verses.kjv: In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah came this word unto Jeremiah from the LORD, saying,
verses.ct: At the start of the reign of Jehoiakim son of Josiah, king of Judah, this message came to Jeremiah from the LORD:

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD to me; Make thee bonds and yokes, and put them upon thy neck,
verses.ct: The LORD told me, "Make straps and yoke bars, and put them on your neck.

verses.kjv: And send them to the king of Edom, and to the king of Moab, and to the king of the Ammonites, and to the king of Tyrus, and to the king of Zidon, by the hand of the messengers which come to Jerusalem unto Zedekiah king of Judah;
verses.ct: Then send them to the king of Edom, the king of Moab, the king of the Ammonites, the king of Tyrus, and the king of Zidon, through the envoys who have come to Jerusalem to visit Zedekiah king of Judah.

verses.kjv: And command them to say unto their masters, Thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel; Thus shall ye say unto your masters;
verses.ct: Give them instructions to tell their rulers: This is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says — deliver this message to your rulers:

verses.kjv: I have made the earth, the man and the beast that are upon the ground, by my great power and by my outstretched arm, and have given it unto whom it seemed meet unto me.
verses.ct: 'I made the earth, along with the people and animals on it, by my great power and my outstretched arm, and I give it to whoever I choose.

verses.kjv: And now have I given all these lands into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, my servant; and the beasts of the field have I given him also to serve him.
verses.ct: Right now I have handed all these lands over to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, my servant. I have even given him the wild animals to be under his control.

verses.kjv: And all nations shall serve him, and his son, and his son’s son, until the very time of his land come: and then many nations and great kings shall serve themselves of him.
verses.ct: Every nation will serve him, then his son, and then his grandson, until the appointed time for his own land arrives. At that point, many nations and powerful kings will make him serve them.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that the nation and kingdom which will not serve the same Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, and that will not put their neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon, that nation will I punish, saith the LORD, with the sword, and with the famine, and with the pestilence, until I have consumed them by his hand.
verses.ct: But any nation or kingdom that refuses to serve this same Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon — any nation that won't submit to the yoke of Babylon's king — I will punish that nation with war, famine, and disease until I have destroyed them through his power," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Therefore hearken not ye to your prophets, nor to your diviners, nor to your dreamers, nor to your enchanters, nor to your sorcerers, which speak unto you, saying, Ye shall not serve the king of Babylon:
verses.ct: "So don't listen to your prophets, your fortune-tellers, your dream interpreters, your spell-casters, or your sorcerers who tell you, 'You won't have to serve the king of Babylon.'

verses.kjv: For they prophesy a lie unto you, to remove you far from your land; and that I should drive you out, and ye should perish.
verses.ct: They are feeding you lies, and the result will be that you get removed far from your homeland. I will drive you out, and you will die.

verses.kjv: But the nations that bring their neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon, and serve him, those will I let remain still in their own land, saith the LORD; and they shall till it, and dwell therein.
verses.ct: But any nation that submits to the yoke of Babylon's king and serves him — I will allow that nation to stay in its own land," says the LORD. "They will farm it and continue living there."

verses.kjv: I spake also to Zedekiah king of Judah according to all these words, saying, Bring your necks under the yoke of the king of Babylon, and serve him and his people, and live.
verses.ct: I spoke the same message to Zedekiah king of Judah, saying, "Submit to the yoke of Babylon's king. Serve him and his people, and you will survive.

verses.kjv: Why will ye die, thou and thy people, by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence, as the LORD hath spoken against the nation that will not serve the king of Babylon?
verses.ct: Why would you and your people choose to die by war, famine, and disease — the very things the LORD has promised will happen to any nation that refuses to serve Babylon's king?

verses.kjv: Therefore hearken not unto the words of the prophets that speak unto you, saying, Ye shall not serve the king of Babylon: for they prophesy a lie unto you.
verses.ct: Don't listen to the prophets who tell you, 'You won't have to serve the king of Babylon.' They are telling you lies.

verses.kjv: For I have not sent them, saith the LORD, yet they prophesy a lie in my name; that I might drive you out, and that ye might perish, ye, and the prophets that prophesy unto you.
verses.ct: I did not send them," says the LORD. "They are prophesying falsely using my name. The outcome will be that I drive you out and you die — both you and the prophets who are giving you these messages."

verses.kjv: Also I spake to the priests and to all this people, saying, Thus saith the LORD; Hearken not to the words of your prophets that prophesy unto you, saying, Behold, the vessels of the LORD’s house shall now shortly be brought again from Babylon: for they prophesy a lie unto you.
verses.ct: I also spoke to the priests and to all the people, saying, "This is what the LORD says: Don't listen to your prophets who tell you, 'Look, the articles from the LORD's temple will be brought back from Babylon any day now.' They are telling you lies.

verses.kjv: Hearken not unto them; serve the king of Babylon, and live: wherefore should this city be laid waste?
verses.ct: Don't listen to them. Serve the king of Babylon and survive. Why should this city be turned into ruins?

verses.kjv: But if they be prophets, and if the word of the LORD be with them, let them now make intercession to the LORD of hosts, that the vessels which are left in the house of the LORD, and in the house of the king of Judah, and at Jerusalem, go not to Babylon.
verses.ct: If they really are prophets and the LORD's message is truly with them, then let them plead with the LORD of hosts that the articles still remaining in the LORD's temple, in the palace of Judah's king, and in Jerusalem won't be taken to Babylon.

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD of hosts concerning the pillars, and concerning the sea, and concerning the bases, and concerning the residue of the vessels that remain in this city,
verses.ct: Because this is what the LORD of hosts says about the pillars, the large bronze basin, the movable stands, and the rest of the articles still remaining in this city —

verses.kjv: Which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon took not, when he carried away captive Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim king of Judah from Jerusalem to Babylon, and all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem;
verses.ct: the ones that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon didn't take when he carried Jeconiah son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, into exile from Jerusalem to Babylon, along with all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem —

verses.kjv: Yea, thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, concerning the vessels that remain in the house of the LORD, and in the house of the king of Judah and of Jerusalem;
verses.ct: yes, this is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says about the articles remaining in the LORD's temple and in the palace of Judah's king and in Jerusalem:

verses.kjv: They shall be carried to Babylon, and there shall they be until the day that I visit them, saith the LORD; then will I bring them up, and restore them to this place.
verses.ct: "They will be carried off to Babylon, and they will stay there until the day I turn my attention to them," says the LORD. "Then I will bring them back and return them to this place."
